channel.title: Will Runescape run fine with
channel.description:
Intel HD 2500? I recently ordered an intel quad core i5 Ivy Bridge and I was wondering if runescape will lag. I really don't feel like spending 125 dollars for a video card when I don't really play alot of games.
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819116506

item.title: Will Runescape run fine with
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:37, topic:454859”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=557725.msg4089572#msg4089572 date=1346198759]
milkman, you aren’t using your graphics card on ‘software’ mode. That mode only utilizes your cpu and ram, not your gpu and vram. This whole thread is moot if you aren’t even testing how well RS runs using your graphics card.
[/quote]

This thread is about me using integrated graphics to run Runescape. Who said anything about using a graphics card???[/quote]

Integrated graphics simply means the gpu is embedded within some other main circuitry, such as the motherboard or processor. By using software mode, the RuneScape client isn’t using the gpu for any sort of rendering. It doesn’t matter whether you have an integrated or dedicated graphics card (or both for that matter), software mode uses the gpu in none of those scenarios. In all scenarios, you have a gpu. So, by using opengl or directx (regardless of integrated or dedicated graphics), THEN you are using the integrated graphics card.

Read full topic

item.title: Will Runescape run fine with
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

milkman, you aren’t using your graphics card on ‘software’ mode. That mode only utilizes your cpu and ram, not your gpu and vram. This whole thread is moot if you aren’t even testing how well RS runs using your graphics card.

[quote=“t4, post:35, topic:454859”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=557725.msg4080570#msg4080570 date=1345327951]
You can build a top of the line gaming rig for like $500; build it yourself.
[/quote]
where the fuck r u buying ur parts lo[/quote]

This. Top of the line means the absolute best, right? Let’s start with the processor; personally, I’d go with an i7-3960X, but that starts at just over $1,000. Hmm, what about the graphics card. Let’s go with a geforce gtx 690, which starts at even higher than the intel card. So just for the processor and graphics card, our top-of-the-line rig is over $2,000.

Read full topic

item.title: Will Runescape run fine with
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:29, topic:454859”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=557725.msg4089116#msg4089116 date=1346151310]

Yeah, 23fps isn’t very good. High also doesn’t always use max details on all parameters. It’s running a bit better than I expected, which is cool for you.

after playing a bit it is averaging about 40+fps on high with resized client.

Very cool. That’s quite surprising. DirectX or OpenGL?

Software.
[/quote]

facepalm you aren’t even using your graphics card, mate. :P[/quote]

Confused as to what you are asking?

free image hosting

[quote=“someone2, post:32, topic:454859”]Yea, I don’t mean you Have to know everything about PC’s, but for the people trying to give advice; don’t unless you know what you are talking about.

Intel HD is not meant for gaming and it cannot run any newer games smoothly. Especially for resource heavy games like RuneScape. I have an GeForce GT 630m with a Intel Core i5 3210m 3.1 GHZ, and I still lag at some parts at RuneScape on high settings.

@Anieli

You could play RuneScape with an Intel chipset, but even on lowest settings it will be very laggy. I know it because I have an laptop with Intel HD 4000 and on lowest settings I get about 20-30 FPS (Which is very unsmooth).[/quote]

You are wrong. It may be slow for you but I run perfectly fine on high detail large screen.

The Wanderer:

I’m one of those people, although i’ve always wanted to get into the hardware aspect more. So I can atleast build my own pc.

I didn’t know exactly what I was doing but I had a good idea. I just matched up a motherboard and cpu then from there it was easy finding components to match the motherboard. Installing the drivers gave me a headache cus I had to install the drivers in order to boot but I needed to boot in order to install the drivers. Lol.

Pic:

runescape_1.png1023×454

Read full topic

item.title: Will Runescape run fine with
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Yeah I have a chipset and it runs about 40 fps on lowest settings. I can’t do fullscreen with anything and it’s around 20 fps with no one around on fixed hd. But I got a free graphics card from a friend and i’m going to put that in sometime. It came from the same model and make of my pc, so it should be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Will Runescape run fine with
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

Yea, I don’t mean you Have to know everything about PC’s, but for the people trying to give advice; don’t unless you know what you are talking about.

Intel HD is not meant for gaming and it cannot run any newer games smoothly. Especially for resource heavy games like RuneScape. I have an GeForce GT 630m with a Intel Core i5 3210m 3.1 GHZ, and I still lag at some parts at RuneScape on high settings.

@Anieli

You could play RuneScape with an Intel chipset, but even on lowest settings it will be very laggy. I know it because I have an laptop with Intel HD 4000 and on lowest settings I get about 20-30 FPS (Which is very unsmooth).

Read full topic

item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Testing now…

Runs perfectly fine (23fps) on high with resizeable screen. (With intel 2500 graphics on a 32 bit OS).

25% CPU with Runescape and Chrome open.

Gnna upgrade to 64bit once my Dad hooks me up.

item.title: Will Runescape run fine with
item.dc:creator: @ggallin ggallin
item.description:
@ggallin wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:22, topic:454859”][quote author=ggallin link=topic=557725.msg4082753#msg4082753 date=1345504335]

I was wondering if runescape will lag. I really don’t feel like spending 125 dollars for a video card when I don’t really play alot of games.

Runescape will always lag with integrated or crappy graphics
a cheap and extremely good graphics card is the nvidia geforce gt 520
you’ll also want a processor with 3.2ghz+ it’s just that much better. I have a 2001 computer i used to play on that was really crappy and had 3.1ghz, i upgraded to a (newer) intel celeron d 3.2ghz and it ran much better, that and my geforce gt 520
[/quote]

I’ve got that GFX card already.[/quote]
okay… that’s good. i guess my point was, never go without one.

Read full topic
